venicehub

Class VeniceReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • venicehub.VeniceReader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ConsoleReader, DebugReader, DiskReader, IIOReader, RSBReader

    public abstract class VeniceReader
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Reads data from source.

    Reads data from source, converts it to a SlotEvent and putting them into the TTEQueue.

    See Also:
    TTEQueue

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        protected void initialize()
        Prepare everything needed to read from source.

        For example: A disk reader has to open file. A net reader has to create slots, and so on.

      • run

        public void run()
        Keeps the thread alive, until deactivated.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • read

        protected venice.lib.parser.SlotEvent read()
        Reads a data item from the source.
        Returns:
        a SlotEvent read from source.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the reader.

        For example: A disk reader will restart at the beginning of the file.

      • stopThread

        public void stopThread()
        Called when this thread has to be stopped.

      • isFinished

        public boolean isFinished()
        Returns true if this Thread can be safely killed.

        After the call of stopThread this Thread will try to get into a safe closing state. For example every open file will be closed.

        Returns:
        true if it is safe to kill this thread

      • pause

        public void pause()
        Pauses the thread.

        To end pause call proceed.

      • proceed

        public void proceed()
        End pause.

      • cleanUp

        protected void cleanUp()
        Clean up, so the Thread can end safely.

        For example: A disk reader has to close the file.
